availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Marion Rowland (Jeffersonville, Indiana, painter and soldier)

body.p: Jeffersonville, Indiana, painter and soldier. Indiana native. Painter in Jeffersonville, Clark County, Indiana, in 1860. Incarcerated for larceny in the Indiana State Penitentiary in 1860. Served in the 28th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 28, 1862, to December 1863. Reported as deserted from convalescent camp in Nashville, Tennessee, in December 1863.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Indiana, Clark County, Jeffersonville, p. 485.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0396.
